# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

The instructions given are not clear, but I can provide a general solution that works for many cases. Here's how you could write the `clean_column` function:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " " => "_", "-" => "_")
end
``` 

This function takes a column name (`col`) as an argument and cleans it by converting all characters to lower case, stripping leading/trailing whitespaces, replacing all spaces with underscores and hyphens, then returning the cleaned column name. Note that this function does not handle special character replacements as specified in the instructions.

If specific replacements are required based on the `instructions`, you would need to provide more context about those specific rules.
